content.question: Let <math> <mrow> <mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow> </math> be the solution to the differential equation <math> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> </math> with the initial condition <math> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>2.</mn> </mrow> </math> What is the approximation for <math> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math> if Eulerâ€™s method is used, starting at <math> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </math> with a step size of 0.5 ?

topic.text: 7.5: (BC ONLY) Approximating Solutions Using Euler's Method

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
